overview: Introduction to differential and integral calculus covering limits, derivatives, integrals, and their applications. Equivalent to AP Calculus AB.
naturalProgression: Start with limits - the foundation of calculus
Move to derivatives - rates of change
Learn integration - the reverse of differentiation
Apply integrals to area and volume problems

modules.title: Limits & Continuity
modules.preview: The foundation of calculus - understanding how functions behave as they approach values

lessons.title: Introduction to Limits
concepts: What is a limit? Understanding function behavior near a point
When limits exist vs don't exist
lessons.teachingNotes: Start with intuitive examples - what value does f(x) approach as x gets close to a? Use tables of values and graphs before formal notation.
commonMistakes: Forgetting that x never actually equals a in a limit

lessons.title: Direct Substitution
keyFormulas: If f is continuous at a, then lim(x→a) f(x) = f(a)
lessons.teachingNotes: This is the easiest case - try it first, then use other techniques if it fails.

lessons.title: Algebraic Limit Techniques
concepts: Factoring to cancel common factors (0/0 indeterminate forms)
lessons.teachingNotes: When direct substitution gives 0/0, that's a signal to factor or simplify first.
commonMistakes: Canceling terms that don't share a common factor
Forgetting to evaluate the limit after simplifying

lessons.title: Limits at Infinity
concepts: End behavior of polynomials and rational functions
Comparing degrees of numerator and denominator
keyFormulas: Same degree: limit = ratio of leading coefficients
lessons.teachingNotes: Focus on leading terms - everything else becomes negligible as x → ∞

lessons.title: Trigonometric Limits
concepts: Related limits with cos and tan
lessons.teachingNotes: These special limits must be memorized. Show why sin(x)/x → 1 using the squeeze theorem or unit circle.

lessons.title: L'Hôpital's Rule
concepts: When to use L'Hôpital's Rule (0/0 or ∞/∞ forms)
Taking derivatives of numerator and denominator separately
Applying the rule multiple times if needed
keyFormulas: If lim f(x)/g(x) gives 0/0 or ∞/∞, then lim f(x)/g(x) = lim f'(x)/g'(x)
lessons.teachingNotes: Only use when you have an indeterminate form! Verify the form first.
commonMistakes: Using L'Hôpital when not in indeterminate form
Taking derivative of the whole fraction instead of separately

lessons.title: Continuity
concepts: Definition of continuity at a point
Three conditions: f(a) exists, limit exists, they're equal
keyFormulas: f is continuous at a if: lim(x→a) f(x) = f(a)
lessons.teachingNotes: Connect to intuition: can you draw the graph without lifting your pencil?

lessons.title: Intermediate Value Theorem
concepts: Using IVT to show solutions exist
keyFormulas: If f is continuous on [a,b] and k is between f(a) and f(b), then f(c)=k for some c in (a,b)
lessons.teachingNotes: Intuitive: a continuous function can't skip values.

modules.title: Derivative Concept
modules.preview: Understanding derivatives as rates of change and slopes of tangent lines

lessons.title: What is a Derivative?
concepts: Average rate of change vs instantaneous rate of change
Derivative as slope of tangent line
lessons.teachingNotes: Build intuition with real examples: velocity, growth rates, marginal cost.

lessons.title: Limit Definition of Derivative
lessons.teachingNotes: Work through several examples by hand before introducing shortcut rules.

lessons.title: Derivative Notation
lessons.teachingNotes: Leibniz notation is helpful for chain rule and related rates later.

lessons.title: Differentiability
concepts: When derivatives don't exist (corners, cusps, vertical tangents)
lessons.teachingNotes: Show examples like |x| at x=0 - continuous but not differentiable.

modules.title: Differentiation Rules
modules.preview: The shortcuts for finding derivatives quickly

lessons.title: Power Rule
lessons.teachingNotes: This handles polynomials completely. Practice until automatic.

lessons.title: Product Rule
concepts: Mnemonic: 'first times derivative of second plus second times derivative of first'

lessons.title: Quotient Rule
concepts: When one function is divided by another
Mnemonic: 'low d-high minus high d-low, over low squared'
lessons.teachingNotes: Can also use product rule with negative exponents, but quotient rule is often easier.

lessons.title: Trigonometric Derivatives
concepts: Derivatives of sin, cos, tan, cot, sec, csc
lessons.teachingNotes: Derive sin and cos from definition, then use quotient rule for the rest.

modules.title: Q1 Checkpoint
modules.preview: Assessment of limits and basic differentiation

modules.title: Advanced Differentiation
modules.preview: Chain rule and special function derivatives

lessons.title: Chain Rule
lessons.teachingNotes: Think of it as 'derivative of outside times derivative of inside'. Practice identifying composite functions.

lessons.title: Exponential and Logarithmic Derivatives
lessons.teachingNotes: e is special because it's its own derivative. Explain why e ≈ 2.718.

lessons.title: Implicit Differentiation
concepts: When y is not explicitly solved for
Treating y as a function of x
Using chain rule on y terms
lessons.teachingNotes: Whenever you differentiate y, multiply by dy/dx (chain rule!).

lessons.title: Inverse Trigonometric Derivatives
concepts: Using implicit differentiation to derive them

lessons.title: Logarithmic Differentiation
concepts: Useful for products/quotients of many terms
lessons.teachingNotes: Most useful when exponent is also a function of x.

modules.title: Applications of Derivatives
modules.preview: Using derivatives to solve real problems

lessons.title: Related Rates
concepts: Variables changing with respect to time
Setting up equations from word problems
Implicit differentiation with respect to t
lessons.teachingNotes: Draw a picture, identify what's changing, write an equation relating quantities, differentiate with respect to t.

lessons.title: Finding Extrema
concepts: Critical points where f'(x) = 0 or undefined
lessons.teachingNotes: Extrema can only occur at critical points or endpoints (on closed intervals).

lessons.title: First Derivative Test
concepts: Sign change at critical point → local extremum
+ to - means local max, - to + means local min

lessons.title: Second Derivative Test
concepts: Concavity: concave up (smile) vs concave down (frown)
f''(c) > 0 at critical point → local min
f''(c) < 0 at critical point → local max

lessons.title: Optimization
concepts: Setting up optimization problems from word problems
lessons.teachingNotes: Read carefully, draw a picture, identify what to maximize/minimize, write equation, take derivative, set to zero.

lessons.title: Mean Value Theorem
concepts: If f is continuous on [a,b] and differentiable on (a,b)
Then f'(c) = [f(b)-f(a)]/(b-a) for some c in (a,b)
Geometric interpretation: tangent parallel to secant

lessons.title: Introduction to Antiderivatives
lessons.teachingNotes: Start by asking 'what function gives us this derivative when we differentiate it?'

lessons.title: Basic Integration Rules
concepts: Power rule for integration: ∫xⁿdx = xⁿ⁺¹/(n+1) + C

lessons.title: Trigonometric Integrals
concepts: Integrals of sin, cos, sec², etc.

lessons.title: u-Substitution
concepts: Changing back to x at the end
lessons.teachingNotes: Look for a function and its derivative together. Let u be the 'inside' function.

lessons.title: Initial Value Problems
concepts: Using initial conditions to find C

modules.title: Definite Integrals
modules.preview: Integration with bounds and the Fundamental Theorem

lessons.title: Riemann Sums
lessons.teachingNotes: Build intuition for what definite integrals represent geometrically.

lessons.title: Definite Integral Definition
concepts: ∫ₐᵇ f(x)dx as limit of Riemann sums

lessons.title: Fundamental Theorem of Calculus - Part 1
concepts: If g(x) = ∫ₐˣ f(t)dt, then g'(x) = f(x)
Differentiation and integration are inverse operations

lessons.title: Fundamental Theorem of Calculus - Part 2
concepts: Where F is any antiderivative of f
This is how we actually evaluate definite integrals!

lessons.title: u-Substitution with Definite Integrals
concepts: Two approaches: change bounds or substitute back

modules.title: Applications of Integration
modules.preview: Using integrals to find areas and volumes

lessons.title: Area Under a Curve
concepts: Basic area calculation with definite integrals

lessons.title: Area Between Curves
concepts: Integrating with respect to y when appropriate

lessons.title: Volumes by Disks and Washers
lessons.teachingNotes: Visualize thin slices perpendicular to axis of rotation.

lessons.title: Volumes by Cylindrical Shells
concepts: When to use shells vs disks/washers

aiGuidanceNotes: When a student says 'teach me calculus' or asks for the next topic, follow this progression. Start with limits, which are foundational. Don't skip ahead to derivatives until they understand limits. Within each module, follow the lesson order. Always check for prerequisite understanding before introducing new concepts.
